name: White Mulberry
climate: White Mulberry can adapt to a range of climates, from temperate to subtropical.
This plant thrives in regions with hot summers and mild winters.
White Mulberry is tolerant of various environmental conditions, growing well in urban areas too.
It can withstand some drought but prefers environments that provide consistent moisture.
sunlight: Full sunlight is ideal for the best growth, fruiting, and vitality of White Mulberry.
Though it prefers full sun, White Mulberry can tolerate partial shade without much impact.
Insufficient sunlight may lead to reduced fruit production and slower growth.
Access to direct sunlight for at least 6 hours daily is beneficial for this plant.
watering: Water this plant regularly during the growing season to promote healthy growth.
White Mulberry prefers well-drained soil but should not be waterlogged at any time.
Reduce watering in the fall and winter months when the plant is dormant.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure pots have proper drainage holes.
soil: Prefers loamy soil with good drainage and organic matter for optimal growth.
White Mulberry can adapt to a range of soils, including sandy types.
Avoid heavy clay soils that retain water excessively and can damage the roots.
Neutral to slightly acidic soil pH levels are ideal for White Mulberry.
toxic: The unripe fruit and the milky sap of white mulberry can be mildly toxic if ingested in large quantities, causing nausea or vomiting.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to shape the tree, improve air circulation, and remove dead branches.
Watch out for pest infestations such as whiteflies or aphids, and manage them accordingly.
